subject.geographic: United States -- History -- War of 1812 -- Battlefields.

subject.topic: Jacksonian democracy and Tennessee's leadership role in the early republic .

mods.note: In this letter, Lemuel Donelson writes of family illness, General Andrew Jackson recovering from his illness in Washington and his own visits to the battlefield of Blandensburg and the ruins of the city of Washington and the Naval Yard with General Jackson.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
